intro: Medicago lupulina subsp. willdenowiana, commonly known as the narrow-leafed clover, is a perennial legume native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a deep root system, which helps it thrive in well-drained soils. It is often found in grasslands, open woodlands, and along roadsides. As a member of the Fabaceae family, it plays a role in nitrogen fixation, improving soil fertility.
